ml:description.p: Did you miss the standing-room-only talk by Mark Helmstetter at the MarkLogic User Conference 2010? Come to the next Mark-UPS meeting (visitors need to sign in at Suite 120, map) and get to know others in the MarkLogic user community.
Pizza and soda will be provided.

About the Speaker:
Mark Helmstetter is a senior consultant in the MarkLogic Federal Professional Services Group. For the last 3 ½ years, Mark has focused on the design and development of MarkLogic applications for MarkLogic’s Federal customers. Mark has over 13 years of software development experience and holds a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from Frostburg State University.
Presentation: XQuery Unit Testing
Software testing is a critical component of the software development process. Testing is necessary to ensure the timely delivery of a quality application. This talk explores several approaches and best practices that can be implemented to test your MarkLogic XQuery libraries, modules, and applications. The talk will provide hands-on XQuery unit testing tips, tools, and techniques.

This presentation is sure to be a good one as Mark’s “Best Practices for XQuery Testing” session at this year’s MarkLogic User’s Conference drew a standing-room-only crowd.
